items.title: What is this website about?
items.content: This is an FAQ website. You can ask questions here and get answers. Use the search bar to find what you're looking for.

items.title: Which side of the building are you going to?
items.content:
How should rollbacks be handled in Dry Shipping? 

Rollbacks need to be stair-stepped to the red peg, then layer-picked down to the pallet. 

What should be done before picking dog food? 

Place a slip sheet on top of the pallet before picking dog food. 

What is the procedure for empty pallets in non-conventional slots? 

Pull empty pallets and place them in designated pallet returns. 

Are pallets laid out on the low side in Dry Shipping? 

No, pallets are not laid out on the low side; only use the pallet dispenser. 

Where are stray and damage stations located? 

Stray and damage stations are generally located in slots near the breezeway. 

How do trips get to the correct wrap machine sides? 

Make sure trips go to the correct wrap machine sides as specified.

items.title: Which side of the building are you going to?
items.category: Out of Area Meat and Produce
items.content:
When is a species divider needed in MP Shipping? 

A species divider is needed under seafood and flowers in MBF and FLW. 

When should pallets be pulled in MP Shipping? 

Pallets only need to be pulled in rollbacks. 

What is the procedure for potatoes? 

Slip sheet needs to be on top of potatoes. 

What is the procedure for RPC’s? 

Use cardboard lids on RPC’s to prevent “nesting”. 

Are RPC’s and 110” slots layer-picked? 

RPC’s and 110” slots are not layer-picked; only a few areas require layer picking. 

Where is the third shrink wrapper located? 

There is a third shrink wrapper location by doors 50-56 on the receiving side. 

Where are stray and damage stations in MP Shipping? 

Stray and damage stations are located in the breezeways and endcaps. 

How are meat room damage bins sorted? 

Meat room damage bins are sorted according to species.

items.title: How do I contact support?
items.content: You can email us at support@example.com or call (555) 123-4567. We respond within 24 hours.

items.title: What are your business hours?
items.content: We are open Monday through Friday, 9am to 6pm. We are closed on weekends and holidays.
